column2: NM DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: New Mexico
column6: NM

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If a traffic signal light is green and a police officer signals you to stop:
column4: you must stop.
column6: you can tell the officer that signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you should obey the traffic signal.

column2: 2. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column8: you should give yourself additional time to stop.

column2: 3. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column6: to turn on your headlights.
column8: to reduce your speed.
column10: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 4. Roads with double solid yellow lines in the center indicate that passing is:
column4: allowed in both directions.
column6: allowed only in your direction of travel.
column8: not allowed in either direction.

column2: 5. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column8: stop and wait for the light to change.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 6. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 7. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
8. To drive defensively you should:
column4: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column6: look only at the car in front of you while driving.
column8: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.

column2: 9. Excessive speed:
column4: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.
column6: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
column8: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.

column2: 10. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Wrong way.
column8: Do not enter.

column2: 11. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must do it.
column6: you must call the police.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 12. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column6: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column8: talk on your cell phone while driving.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Merge right
column6: Lane ends
column8: Divided highway begins

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: No Bicycle zone
column6: Bicycle repair shop ahead
column8: Bicycles have the right-of-way

column2: 15. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: when a child is about to run into the street.
column6: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column8: you have lost control of your vehicle and are moving towards someone.

column2: 16. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your hands off the wheel
column6: take your attention away from driving
column8: take your eyes off the road

column2: 17. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels toward the curb.
column6: leave the wheels straight.
column8: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a low place in the road.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 19. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 20. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the steering ability.
column6: It improves the vehicle stability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 21. You may pass another vehicle:
column4: on the shoulder of the highway.
column6: when there is a solid yellow line on your side.
column8: on a curve or a hill.

column2: 22. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must change lane immediately.
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 23. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: by slowing down and making sure they are being seen by pedestrians.
column6: when pedestrians are crossing within a marked or unmarked crosswalk.
column8: Always.

column2: 24. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column4: the center
column6: the right side
column8: either side

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks ahead
column6: Do not pass trucks
column8: Truck must back up
